Port Hope Simpson is accessible by Trans-Labrador Highway Route 510, air, and by sea.

value: By road from the south take Rte 510,

four kilometres north of Blanc Sablon paved highway for 86 km to Red Bay. Take new gravel highway for 74 km to Lodge Bay,  Services en route at Mary's Harbour: gas, food, accommodation, medical, airstrip, banking, crafts & gifts. Then take new gravel highway for 62 km from Red Bay to Port Hope Simpson's main retail and public services including an airstrip and deep water port. Total: 222 km.
By road from the north take Rte 510
new gravel highway from Cartwright for 187 km. Services: none. Services at Cartwright: gas, food, medical, accommodations, repair, shopping, crafts.
for schedules, rates and reservations at the Blanc Sablon terminal phone the Strait of Belle Isle Ferry Service 1-866-535-2567 and the Quebec North Shore Ferry Service 1-418-723-8787.
There are extensive snowmobile trails connecting Port Hope Simpson with the communities of Cartwright, Black Tickle, Charlottetown, Mary's Harbour, Battle Harbour, Lodge Bay and Red Bay. Information:
), about 2 km south of town. (106 m runway)

To reach Port Hope Simpson from the south:
operates coastal ferry freight service during the summer months. Phone 709 960-0292,.

. operates a drive-on, drive-off 90 minute daily crossing service from St. Barbe to Blanc Sablon. The MV Apollo easily carries some 70 vehicles including capacity for full-sized tractortrailer trucks in addition to motorcoaches, and RVs.

operates a passenger-cargo service along the Lower North Shore of Quebec to Blanc Sablon. As the N/M Nordik Express stops in each port to unload supplies you have opportunity to visit the villages and historic attractions.
To reach Port Hope Simpson from the north:
operates the M/V Sir Robert Bond to Cartwright and Rte 510.

the coastal boat operates from Happy Valley-Goose Bay to Cartwright and Rte 510 on a weekly basis and provides a twice weekly service between Charlottetown Rte 510 and Port Hope Simpson, weather permitting.

By boat, ferry, car, truck, snowmobile, snowshoes, skis depending on the time of year. Deep water port with docking facilities, regional airstrip, helicopter pads, groomed snowmobile trails, Nordic ski trails and overnight cabin, gravel road.

value: Alexis Hotel Gas Bar Port Hope Simpson, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada; Contact Details:
Postal Address: Carol Burden, Alexis Hotel, 2 Alexis Drive, P.O. Box 10, Port Hope Simpson. Labrador, A0K4E0 Phone: 709 960 0228, Fax: 709 960 0210
P & K Sports and Automotive Port Hope Simpson, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada

You can fuel up with gas or diesel, enjoy a cup of hot tea or coffee or cool down with a soft serve or bakeapple sundae. Services include rental cabins or cottages, Labrador souvenirs and confectionery, fishing gear, garage services, tire repairs, towing service and gas bar. P & K also carry snowmobiles, snowmobile parts [Polaris snowmobile dealers] and clothing. Contact Details: Tom or Lydia Penney, Phone: 709 960-0444, Fax: (709) 960-0416 Postal Address: P & K Sports and Automotive P.O. Box 149, Port Hope Simpson, NL A0K 4E0.
Penney's Pitstop Port Hope Simpson, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada: Contact Details:

Charlene Penney Phone: 709 960-0499 Fax: 709 960-0474 1 Trans Labrador Highway Port Hope Simpson, NL A0K 4E0 Penney's Pitstop is a gas station and full-service garage. They also rent out a variety of items such as U-Haul trucks, a vehicle, a wood splitter and movies.
Recreational Vehicle RV Park, Port Hope Simpson, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada: Russell's RV Park, Contact Details:
Stella & Redge Russell Phone: 709.960.0405 / 0303 Stella and Reg Russell operate this RV Park next to Port Hope Hardware and Building Supplies.

Port Hope Simpson has a range of "retail and public services including an airstrip and deep water anchorage. Several government services are available as well as many non-profit organizations and tourist activities such as hiking, camping, fishing, angling, snowmobiling, whale watching and icebergs." Source: South Eastern Aurora Development Corporation

A week long event of sporting activities and entertainment in Port Hope Simpson; Phone 709 960-0240; Fax 709 960-0210.

A celebration of friends that promotes and encourages a sense of pride and accomplishments; it's time for food and laughter; Port Hope Simpson has an open door policy for family, friends and visitors! Held annually in the last weekend of July. Phone 709 960-0222; Fax 709 960-0210.
salmon, trout and sports-fishing; Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709-960-0210;

'Find the Geocache' and take a digital photograph at each site with the banner found in the Geocache [Please remember to return the banner to the Geocasche for your fellow Geocashers.] Your unique Geocache passport will be stamped for each Geocache you have found and if you have managed to find all 10 Geocaches with 10 valid stamps in your passport you will receive an Alexis Geocache T-shirt. Phone Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
available to explore the 'Big Country' around Port Hope Simpson Phone Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
Bonfires light the sky; weiner and marshmallow roast, family and friends gathering; all visitors welcome; Phone 709 960-0236; Fax 709 960-0387.

Explore the favourite haunts of the locals. Places where parties gather for a traditional boil-up and fishing through a hole in the ice for trout and smelts. Phone Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
Thursday nights all-year-round at 8PM. Drop in and win some fun and exciting prizes, 19 years and over. Phone Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
Ride on the finest of snowmobile trails to Port Hope Simpson for a weekend of fun and entertainment; held annually last weekend in February; Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.

While travelling along the Labrador Coastal Drive submit your three favourite photographs with the name, date and address where the photograph was taken. The general public will vote for a winner in each category. Participants will be informed about the exhibit and voting dates. Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709-960-0210;

dinner theatre on Wednesday nights at 7PM during July and August. Join us as we present Port Hope Simpson in the 30s, when the great depression was looming and England needed wood. Sir John Hope Simpson arrived in an area short on jobs but long on "Big Wood". We celebrate the unique history of Alexis Bay. Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 960-0210; Contact Carol Burden

All are challenged to take a dip in our chilly Labrador water; all participants receive a memento T-shirt; this event is followed by a night's entertainment at the Alexis Hotel, May; Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 960-0210; Contact Carol Burden
Skis, snowmobile and snowshoes - a day on each!
For groups of 6 or more, a 3 day challenging event. Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.

Snowshoe or ski the trails around Port Hope Simpson or the un-tracked back-country where the scenery is spectacular through wooded hills, scenic valleys and frozen ponds. Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
Bird-watching, iceberg-watching, whale-watching and wildlife. Phone 709 960-0228; Fax 709 920-0210.
name=Campbell's Place B&B and Coffee Shop
directions=From Goose Bay take the first two left turns. From Red Bay Turn right at Penney's Pitstop then turn left at the next stop sign - stay on Pioneer St
content=Soup, chilli, baked beans, homemade subs, sandwiches, pizza by the slice and a large selection of baked goodies.
content=Air conditioned dining room and snack bar overlooking Alexis Bay. Take-out available.
content=Accommodation, tour operator, restaurant and take-out service, conference facilities, friendly professional staff, on-site liquor store, supermarket, postal services, gifts and gas bar.

content=Offers a variety of services. You can fuel up with gas or diesel, enjoy a cup of hot tea or coffee, or cool down with a soft serve or baked apple sundae. They offer an assortment of items from fishing gear to Labrador souvenirs and are Polaris snowmobile dealers. They can arrange cottage or cabin accommodations or provide automotive repairs, tire repairs and towing services.

content=Bed and breakfast has four rooms with private baths. TV and Wi-Fi along with access to a telephone. A full breakfast and complimentary tea and coffee are included. Guest also has access to a common room and laundry facilities.
